result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin A Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 14CF97, 14CF109, 14CF137 and 14CF139 called at 8:37am.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Justin A Hill in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  Defendant Justin A Hill in custody.  Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Procedural issues addressed by the Court and Counsel. 
Agent Leah Hartman appears by phone to address questions posed by the Court and Counsel related to credit for time served.  Agent Hartman concurs that the Revocation Warrant and Order is in error as it relates to sentence credit in case 14CF139.  She will make the individual that prepares those documents aware of the error and request that an Amended be prepared. (Court excuses Ms. Hartman for the balance of the hearing.) 
Sentencing recommendations presented by Counsel. 
Statement presented by the defendant. 
The Court orders:
14CF109 - Count #2:
Court sentences the defendant to 5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3  years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith.  The defendant has credit for 201 days time served in this case. The Court finds the defendant to be eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program. 
-  Conditions of probations (including financial obligations) are to become conditions of Extended Supervision.

14CF139 - Count #1:
Court sentences   to  3  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1   years &    months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years &    months.  This sentence is ordered concurrent to the sentence ordered in 14CF109.  The defendant has credit for 111 days time served in this case. The Court finds the defendant to be eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program. 
-  Conditions of probations (including financial obligations) are to become conditions of Extended Supervision.

14CF97 - Count #1:
-  6 months jail, to be served in the prison system. This sentence is concurrent to the sentences ordered in case 14CF139 and 14CF109.  The defendant has credit for 111 days time served in this case. 
-  Conditions of probations (including financial obligations) are to become conditions of Extended Supervision.

14CF97 - Count #2:
-  90 days jail, to be served in the prison system. This sentence is concurrent to the sentences ordered in case 14CF139 and 14CF109.  The defendant has credit for 111 days time served in this case. 
-  Conditions of probations (including financial obligations) are to become conditions of Extended Supervision.

14CF137 - Count #1:
-  30 days jail, to be served in the prison system. This sentence is concurrent to the sentences ordered in case 14CF109, 14CF139 and 14CF97.  The defendant has credit for 111 days time served in this case. 
-  Conditions of probations (including financial obligations) are to become conditions of Extended Supervision.

Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence reviewed by the Court (copy provided to the defendant.) 
Recess 9:17am

cases #14CM127, #14CF97, #14CF109, #14CF137, #14CF139 called at 10:20am. [MK]
Defendant Justin A Hill in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On Motion of the State, the Court amends Case #14CF97 to modify Count #1 to Misdemeanor Battery contrary to Statute 940.19(1) and to add a Count #2 of Disorderly Conduct contrary to Statute 947.01(1). 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " entered on Case #14CF97 Counts #1 and #2, Case #14CF109 Count #2, Case #14CF137 on Count #1, Case #14CF139 on Count #1 ; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (ADA Shock submits the victim impact statement in case #14CF97); the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #14CF109 Count #1, Case #14CF137 on Count #2, Case #14CF139 on Count #2, and Case #14CM127.

On Case #14CF97 Counts #1 and #2, Case #14CF109 Count #2, Case #14CF137 on Count #1, Case #14CF139 on Count #1 each, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Hill on Probation concurrent.  The lenght of the Probation term is for two years on each count of #14CF97, for three years in Case #14CF109, for one year in Case #14CF137, and for three years in Case #14CF139.  The conditions of Probation are: 

--to undergo AODA assessment and to follow through with all treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to submit to random urinalyses or other drug testing as required by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and from non-prescribed prescription drugs
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores except as allowed by the Agent for employment purposes
--to obtain and maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--the Court does not restrict Mr. Hill's contact with Therese Baker, TJH (dob 7/12/1996) or Terry Hill; if any further issues arise, the Probation Agent may deem it appropriate to impose contact limitations
--Mr. Hill is not to possess any financial transaction documents (debit cards, credit cards, account numbers) that are not in his own name
--Mr. Hill is not to be employed in any job that requires or allows him to handle any prescription medications or narcotics 
--in Cases #14CF109 and #14CF139: to comply with DNA sample provision upon request
--in Case #14CF97: to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge on each count ($886 total)
--in Case #14CF109: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--in Case #14CF137: to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge
--in Case #14CF139: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
;   
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given. 
The Court grants the Defendant's request for expungement of Cases #14CF109 and #14CF139 if Mr. Hill successfully completes the Probation terms; Mr. Hill would need to submit a written petition for this when he completes his Probation terms.  The Court will not consider expungement of the other cases. 
recess 10:52am.
For continuance is granted
Status conference on November 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Proposed for motion for continuance
Status conference on October 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.

cases #14CF97, #14CF109, #14CF137, #14CF139, #14CM127 called at 9:41am. 
Defendant Justin A Hill in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Svehlek indicates that she has further information to provide to the State, so she is requesting another Pretrial Conference.  
Mr. Hill provides a new address of:  504 N. Carroll Street in Madison, WI 
Attorney Svehlek indicates that Mr. Hill is interviewing for employment as a security staffperson at an establishment that serves liquor; the Defense is requesting an exception to the bond conditions to allow for such employment.  
The Court amends the Bonds [Clerk's note:  applicable bonds are #14CF137, #14CF139, #14CM127] to allow for an exception that Mr. Hill may be present in bars and taverns for the sole purpose of employment and only during work hours;  and also, an exception that Mr. Hill may possess alcohol during employment, however he may not consume alcohol.  
recess 9:45am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/24/14 at 10:00am (2) schedule Status Conference after Pretrial date

cases #14CF97,#14CF109,#14CF137,#14CF139, #14CM127 called at 8:47am. 
Defendant Justin A Hill in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

INITIAL APPEARANCES HELD IN CASES #14CF137,#14CF139,#14CM127:
Service of Complaints admitted, readings waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Plea of "Not Guilty" entered in case #14CM127; speedy trial waived.

WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARING & ARRAIGNMENT HELD IN CASES #14CF97,#14CF109,#14CF137,#14CF139:
In all four cases, Mr. Hill waives his right to Preliminary Hearings; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trials.
Service of Informations admitted, readings waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered on all cases.

The Court requires a $750 Signature Bond as to each file in case #14CF137 and #14CF139 and #14CM127, with conditions: 
--in case #14CM127 only, a condition of: no discussion of the facts of the case with Therese Baker
--no acts or threats of violence
--to maintain absolute sobriety which includes no possession or consumption of alcohol; no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--to take all prescription drugs only as prescribed 
--to provide new address within 48 hours of signing the bond
--in cases #14CF137 and #14CF139 only, a condition of: to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
 

In response to the Court's inquiries about returned mail, Attorney Svehlek indicates that Mr. Hill is moving to Eagle, WI later today, and she will provide Mr. Hill's new address, once it is known--but within 48 hours. 
recess 8:58am. 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 6/25/14 at 10:40am (2) schedule all five cases for Status Conference after the Pretrial Conference
Motion for Continuance is granted
Waiver of Prelim on June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

case called at 1:35pm. 
Defendant Justin A Hill appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel).  
Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000 signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Terry Hill or Dianne Hill
--no possession of financial documents not issued in his own name
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--Mr. Hill is to notify the Clerk of Courts Office within 48 hours of his new address [by 3/26/14 at 4:00pm]
recess 1:44pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/30/14 at 9:00am. (2) schedule Preliminary Hearing on a date after the Pretrial
